data.title: Now on sale: Snoop Dogg and Wiz Khalifa join smokin’ 4/20 show lineup
data.meta_description: Now on sale: Snoop Dogg and Wiz Khalifa join smokin' 4/20 show lineup
data.text:
Now that April 20 is a full-fledged — if not entirely official — holiday in Colorado, concert promoters are eager to cash in on the 4/20-related festivities. This year’s installment is shaping up to be the biggest yet, including a stoner-friendly Snoop Dogg and Wiz Khalifa show at Red Rocks Amphitheatre on April 20 with YG and Smoke DZA. Tickets are on sale at 10 a.m. Feb. 28. ($59.50-$100, axs.com)

Thanks to their frequent pops collaborations, the members of the Colorado Symphony Orchestra may just be the largest, best-dressed group of session musicians in the region. Up next: backing the Indigo Girls and Mary Chapin Carpenter at Red Rocks Amphitheatre on July 27. Tickets are on sale at 10 a.m. Feb. 28. ($39.95-$59.50, axs.com)

Also announced for Red Rocks: Road warriors Grace Potter & the Nocturnals will headline on Sept. 20, with opening sets from Trombone Shorty & Orleans Avenue and Lake Street Dive. Tickets are on sale at 10 a.m. Feb. 28. ($39.95-$46.50, axs.com)

Seth Meyers will take a break from his new job helming “Late Night” on NBC to play Denver’s Ellie Caulkins Opera House on Sept. 13 to benefit the Zarlengo Foundation, which supports families with learning-disabled children. Tickets are on sale at 10 a.m. Feb. 28. ($49.50-$59.50, Ticketmaster)

The annual Westword Music Showcase returns June 21 with sets from Diplo, 2 Chainz, Cherub, King Khan & the Shrines, Man Man, Claymore Disco and dozens of Denver’s best rock, folk, indie, hip-hop, electro and metal acts. Tickets are on sale. ($25-$75, ticketfly.com)

106.7 KBPI’s annual “low dough” show lives up to its name with sets from All That Remains, the Pretty Reckless, Starset and others to be announced — all for only $10.67, including all service charges. Passes for the May 30 hard-rock event at the Fillmore Auditorium are on sale at 10 a.m. Feb. 28 via Ticketmaster.

Rock legend Steve Winwood is returning to Denver’s Paramount Theatre less than two years after his last set. Tickets for the June 22 concert are on sale at 10 a.m. Feb. 28. ($49.50-$99.50, altitudetickets.com)
